channel.title: CVE Feed for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache Syncope
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache Syncope

item.title: CVE-2018-1321|2024-08-05T03:59:37.666Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20syncope
item.description: An administrator with report and template entitlements in Apache Syncope 1.2.x before 1.2.11, 2.0.x before 2.0.8, and unsupported releases 1.0.x and 1.1.x which may be also affected, can use XSL Transformations (XSLT) to perform malicious operations, including but not limited to file read, file write, and code execution.

item.title: CVE-2018-17184|2024-08-05T10:39:59.596Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20syncope
item.description: A malicious user with enough administration entitlements can inject html-like elements containing JavaScript statements into Connector names, Report names, AnyTypeClass keys and Policy descriptions. When another user with enough administration entitlements edits one of the Entities above via Admin Console, the injected JavaScript code is executed.

item.title: CVE-2018-17186|2024-08-05T10:39:59.572Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20syncope
item.description: An administrator with workflow definition entitlements can use DTD to perform malicious operations, including but not limited to file read, file write, and code execution.

item.title: CVE-2018-1322|2024-08-05T03:59:38.575Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20syncope
item.description: An administrator with user search entitlements in Apache Syncope 1.2.x before 1.2.11, 2.0.x before 2.0.8, and unsupported releases 1.0.x and 1.1.x which may be also affected, can recover sensitive security values using the fiql and orderby parameters.

item.title: CVE-2024-38503|2024-07-22T18:24:30.812Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20syncope
item.description:
When editing a user, group or any object in the Syncope Console, HTML tags could be added to any text field and could lead to potential exploits. The same vulnerability was found in the Syncope Enduser, when editing “Personal Information” or “User Requests”.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 3.0.8, which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-38503|2024-07-22T09:54:13.388Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20syncope
item.description:
When editing a user, group or any object in the Syncope Console, HTML tags could be added to any text field and could lead to potential exploits. The same vulnerability was found in the Syncope Enduser, when editing “Personal Information” or “User Requests”.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 3.0.8, which fixes this issue.

item.description:
When editing a user, group or any object in the Syncope Console, HTML tags could be added to any text field and could lead to potential exploits. The same vulnerability was found in the Syncope Enduser, when editing “Personal Information” or “User Requests”.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 3.0.8, which fixes this issue.
